alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Herkimer; Northern Warren; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 12:37PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A BAND OF BRIEF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN FULTON... NORTHERN HERKIMER...HAMILTON...NORTHERN FULTON...SOUTHERN HERKIMER...MONTGOMERY...AND NORTHERN WARREN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of brief heavy snow showers accompanied by wind gusts of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile will usher in rapidly falling temperatures and possible flash freeze conditions on areas roads. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1233 PM EST, a band of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Big Moose to Trenton to near Solsville and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Big Moose and Northwood around 1240 PM EST. Poland, Cold Brook and Eagle Bay around 1245 PM EST. Ohio, West Winfield, Newport and Middleville around 1250 PM EST. Raquette Lake, Brown Tract Pond Campground, Eighth Lake Campground and Cedarville around 1255 PM EST. Golden Beach Campground around 100 PM EST. Forked Lake Public Campground around 105 PM EST. Dolgeville, Stratford and Blue Mountain Lake around 110 PM EST. Lake Durant Campground around 115 PM EST. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29 and 30. SAFETY INFO... A rapid drop in temperature may cause black ice to form on roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear only wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Northern Herkimer; Northern Warren; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer
